body:
Official, MapDev and Moderator. Leader of Bad Company. I come from OCN :o and I am Global Elite on CS:GO and I am currently playing in ESEA Open.

I'd really like Static if the TnT wasn't messed up when I played it, so I'd go with Rendezvous CTW. The worse is Rendezvous DTM because it's so stalematey.

Thank you!

The ranks on here don't really affect me, I hop on and moderate when I have nothing to do, I official because it's fun and develop maps when I get an idea in my head. I don't take any pride in my ranks on here, however where I am at on CS considering I'm 13 is something I'm proud of.

Notal :D A lot of Apollo and some PPB

no

You guys have a lot of potential, but you have a lot of people who are not as good as the rest and a lot of you are scared to kick them because you're all good friends. However, you can still be friends with people and not be in the same team which I don't think a lot of you understand. To win a tournament you need to get rid of some players and then you have a good chance.

It's hard work and we need to get more active people.

replies.body:
"You guys have a lot of potential, but you have a lot of people who are not as good as the rest and a lot of you are scared to kick them because you're all good friends. However, you can still be friends with people and not be in the same team which I don't think a lot of you understand. To win a tournament you need to get rid of some players and then you have a good chance."

Apollo started out as a bunch of friends and we never intended to get good, just to have fun.
Me and Pizza agreed to keep it this way a long time ago and this is why a lot of our friends are on the team.
We have no plans on winning tournaments, or becoming the new FaZe clan, sorry :P

replies.body:
Avicus

Pros:
  • Community is great, everyone is a lot closer together because of the lack of players.
  • Competitive scene is fun but inactive
  • Rentable scrim servers
Cons:
  • Devs are way too focused on public instead of the competitive scene
  • Player count is too small, which means lack of teams
  • Senior staff are so far behind on hack detection
OCN

Pros:
  • Community is a lot bigger and more drawn out
  • Competitive scene is a lot better, more skilled and bigger
  • Better servers
  • Staff team is more organised
  • Tournaments are bigger and therefore better
Cons:
  • Lack of developers, and they focus on mutiliations instead of important shit
  • Community is less together
  • Moderators are so far behind on hack detection
  • IT'S ABOUT TO BE 1.9
Both servers lack an anticheat which would improve either server so much.
replies.body_tagged:

OCN

  • Competitive scene is a lot better, more skilled and bigger
  • Better servers
  • Staff team is more organised
  • Tournaments are bigger and therefore better
Cons:

  • Community is less together
  • Moderators are so far behind on hack detection
  • IT'S ABOUT TO BE 1.9
Both servers lack an anticheat which would improve either server so much.
